reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do Not Buy

They are not making the game they have outlined here.

They are taking what looked like a potentially interesting survival crafting game and making some sort of PVP game. They have decided to return to the proverbial drawing board on this and make something other than what they have listed in this description. Save your money and wait to see what happens in the next couple months.

I'm personally shafted on a refund on this game even though what they sold me is not what they are planning on shipping. I played more than 2 hours and it's more than the 14 days since I purchased. Their shift in direction happened well outside their initial early access release so anybody that like what they were presenting and decided to help support it are all burned. So save your money and don't buy the crap they are selling in the description.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The promise of getting a game that involved building a base and surviving a hostile sci-fi environment made me get this early access game. At first, a steady stream of improvements to the shoddy gameplay kept me interested. The dev reacted to forum posts with relevant posts.

Then forum replies became shorter and more generic. Thank you - we thought of that too". Then the updates stopped completely
date: and now it feels like the devs have scooped up the early acces revenues and went on a nice vacation.\nNo replies in the forums for a month or so
hoursPlayed: no news... There is just silence.\n\nIn this state the game is not finished and running around the map has no point. Because of this
voteText: nobody logs in
helpfulPercent: and the game is empty. No players
votesHelpful: no goal. A huge potential though
votesTotal: and lots of ideas and input from the community. Unfortunately Salty does not seem to work on the game anymore.\n\nAtari and Steam have both attached their name and reputation to this
votesFunny: so I did not expect to lose my 30 EUR this easy. A (partial) refund would be appropriate in case the developers decide not to finish the game
commentsCount:
since development stopped after only a few weeks.

DO NOT BUY.

My last "early access" purchase

Early Access Review

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Avoid! Avoid like the plague! It's a scam. I bought this right after it was released, stupidly thinking that with the name of Atari attached, it would be a good one. I was wrong. They're still selling this game, and Atari is still advertising it on its website, but the servers have been inaccessible since about the 15th of May. That means the game is unplayable. There has been no communication  or updates from the developers since April. Again. Avoid like the plague. It is, or rather was, an online game, and without servers, you cannot play. Game is dead. Buyers like me were cheated. UPDATE: Servers were down (or just not allowing connections), from the 14 of May until the 28th of May. They're back up now. Still no statements from the developers. Will update review further with any new developments.
Update. It's September. Servers are down again. Have been for days....no word from devs. It is now November...still down. Not a word from Atari. What's funny is that Steam is still selling this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The settings don't actually do anything and the gameplay is non-existent.

I'm having a really hard time understanding the decision to start charging money for this. For an earily access, I don't expect much but I do want to see a workable concept if you are asking for money.

Is there some alternate dimension where the devs are actually able to have fun with this?
Are the they just nefariously milking the concept for cash before folding?
Time may tell but, unless you have cash to burn, feel free to wait until this block of random code actually develops in to a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

5 reasons:

Servers Offline

Webite for game down

Devs last updated in July 2015

User that uploads the game patches has been offline for 244 days as of today.

Atari Silently Killed this project. No explaintion. No refunds for us. $30 down the drain to fund a now non playable product. RIPOFFS SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED. NEW ONES ARE ADDED TO KICKSTARTER EVERY DAY. WE DON'T NEED THAT HERE. WE DON'T WANT THAT HERE.


Result: Atari won't be getting any more money from me. not even buying a roller coster tycoon game. Early Access is about as risky as crowd funding, And I am going to wait for relases if a game is in early access from now on. If it's released, I will buy it.

Steam should not have early access game be under the refund policy. They should be EXEMPT UNTIL RELEASE. Also a red flag system should be in place for people who work for steam to review the game. IF STEAM REMOVES AN EARLY ACCESS GAME UNDER A RED FLAG, ALL PEOPLE SHOUD GET A REFUND REGUARLESS OF WHAT IT WAS OR HOW MUCH TIME.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game doesn't even have enough content to be called Early Access...... I'm currently studying Game Programming, and I could quite easily make this game (minus the art assets) fairly quickly...... I'd be genuinely suprised if there are more than 2 people working on this game......

I understand if the Developer wants to get their game out there on the market and see what the public thinks about their concept....... but they should at least scale the price accordingly....... I mean USD$30 ...... SUCH A ******* RIP-OFF!
Maybe $10 dead max would be suitable..... I'd even suggest the price to be set to $2.00 for the wonderful" 5 minutes of gameplay that this game provides...........

Open World - Hardly..... you'd die of suffocation before you get more than 200m away from your base......
Sandbox - Nope... You build a base of set components that don't even do anything ..... and the only thing that you can mine is asteroids that you shoot down (with crappy hit-boxes ..so half the time your bullets go straight through them too...) ...definitely NOT sandbox.
Survival Game - Yeah... pretty much the only thing you can do is die. Suffocate
recommended:
pvp? Maybe? I mean... you have a gun............. but that's about as far as that goes.....

There are about 25 different servers - 3 of them had 1 person online each. Multiplayer..? Not without other people.....

Early Access ....?? More like EARLY EARLY EARLY EARLY EARLY EARLY ......... EARLY EARLY ACCESS.....


TL;DR
Unless they lower the price to $2 - don't buy it! It's a waste of money! I wouldn't even call it a game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Full Preview - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kdjklPfWRkw

** Game is still very early on in its development with only the bare basics. I cannot recommend it in its current state **

Positives

- Interesting Implementation of the Asteroids Gameplay
- Promising Grid Based Building System
- Large Maps and Large Plots to Build On

Negatives

- No Mid or End Game Yet
- No Real PvE Threat
- No Gameplay Outside of Shooting Asteroids and Mining them At the Moment

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DISCLAIMER: As of launch, Asteroids: Outpost is not even ready for Early Access. It's a technical nightmare. Don't. Three separate ToS agreements, outside updater that's slower than dial-up, settings that don't stick, controls that won't remap, consistent bugs. It's not fun.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iB2j-Ebi1yY&list=UUDX01EolmvH_miJ1BP67O1w
This clip even shows a save-wiping bug.

Now, that said, the concept of shooting down raining asteroids from the sky, to then mine their resources on a mad dash and build a giant space station is interesting. If it can make competitive play optional and create some variety outside of this core mechanism, there could be a crowd for this, even if it has nothing to do with Asteroids. Let's be clear on that last one. Whatever Atari is doing to their franchises, it's not honoring their olden ways. For fellow veterans who can settle for something different, it might just be a slight alteration to the sandbox model.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While it is in the VERY early stage, at the moment you can do everything in about an hour, IF, you gain the correct minerals to trade. So please beware this before purchase.  Some elements are still not complete but, as its still an early apha release you can understand this. After all, game in progress means what its says..

Ok .. game looks beautiful, needs some tips at the start to actually tell you what the aim is... but the forum can help with that to.   From then on its pretty much simple.  It is at the moment PVP based,  if your neibour wants to come and VISIT you with his assault rifle, he can pretty much ransack your base. The devs say thay are working on ideas to combat this. I would like to see a PVE version with asteroid bugs to eat your ore and random gang up on you...  would be nice...  starship trooper bugs! but alas .. dreams are fun..   Overall i recommend this game, do remember its not finished and may never be what you expect when its complete. That should be in your mind before purchase.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe atmosphere of this game looks very authentic and true to the survival theme. You have limited oxygen which forces you to manage your mining runs intelligently. The survival is made more intense by the meteor bombardment which can kill you or destroy your HQ and other structures. If this is the taste of what the dev has in store for us then I am very excited for what’s about to come. The game is still in Pre-Alpha stage so a bit of patience is required to experience the potential and fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Vous voilà l'heureux propriétaire d'une mini base spatiale sous le bombardement incéssant d'astéroides comme vous disposez d'une tourelle vous êtes relativement protégé mais plus votre base s'agrandira plus elle sera exposée aux météorites mortels. Votre rôle agrandir votre base, devenir plus puissant et garder vos voisins humains envieux à distance. Si vous êtes capable de descendre les métorites en les visant avec votre tourelle avant qu'ils ne vous touchent vous devrez aller voir sur place ce qu'ils contiennent car cela peut se vendre pour obtenir des upgrades ou pour construire d'autres batiments pour votre base mais attention à chaque fois que vous sortez vous pouvez recevoir un astéroide sur la tête alors sortez à couvert et courrez vite en levant les yeux au ciel pour éviter ce qui tombe du ciel sans oublier que votre réserve d'air est limitée.

Les + : graphismes, idée originale, univers 3D, action et combat avec ou contre les autres joueurs humains

Les - : gameplay limité mais jeu encore en dévelloppement et uniquement en Anglais

i see promise in it and look forward to what it will become,
this game is in pre alpha as the moment of this writing and i have a little less than 2 hours of game time in thus far, but i have managed to get all the initial upgrades in the menues and one of each structure. so not complelty blind as most reviews of such low play time are. this is buggy and is expected to be as it is in early access. so unless you have the patience for repititive crashes, audio sliders that dont save and in general not a whole lot to do as of yet, its not for u just yet

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nShows promise. Pretty buggy at the moment, lots of unrecoverable issues which require relaunching. I'm sure they'll get around to it, this is the day after pre-alpha release after all. You can mine things, you can drive around a mine car. I think the major appeal of this game would come with playing it against a few friends in a smaller area/underpopulated server. You could fight and struggle for resources. However, the lack of survival elements at present don't create enough risk to make the player fear the environment, resource gathering or even other players. If you see these features being added, then maybe you should play this game. Seems kinda fun anyway.

Asteroids threaten to destroy you and everything you created but they give you a fighting chance with turrets. Minus the bugs I am very excited and want to see a full release for the game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI want to try this game with lots of other people and experience the competitiveness. I can’t wait for the time when me and my buddies work cooperatively to establish dominance and earn respect all while using cool gadgets. Way to go Atari!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've really been enjoying Asteroids: Outpost so far. There's definitely still development to be done, but in just the short time I've been playing the teams at Salty and Atari have added a lot to the game and continually deployed fixes, tweaks, and new content. Definitely worth picking up if you enjoy following games through their Early Access phase!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I thought I'd give this game a go as I was kinda intrigued. Yep its definately early access, I've had a few crashes and got stuck in some Quartz once but there's the core of a nice game in here. The graphics are not bad either.

I made a video of my early stages of playing this game, see what you think.

http://youtu.be/Sks4psFWg78

(The video is taking an age to process at YouTubes end, so it may not be available at top quality as I type this, check back later if its not. Youtube need to replace the dusty old 286's they have in their server farm).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a clear warning everyone: STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME! It's like looking at nudes from your ex and then calling her to come over. Yeah sure the menu looks pretty, but when you get the actual serving it's like feces boiled in a rusty microwave.

This piece of code is a mess. I have hardly played 90 minutes and I have already managed to be defiled in so many ways I am applying for therapy first thing tommorow. The abuse includes, but is not limited to:

- Fallen through the map
- Gamecrash 6 times. Every time I alt-tab as well (excluded)
- Gotten killed bhy an astroid, respawned and being completely unable to ever buy any upgrade ever again, or customize character
- Had a vehicle spasm to the end of the earth
- Been able to build a huge base for free
- Not been able to remove any parts of my own
- Had animations suspended or frozen completely
- Randomly dissconnected
- Respawned inside a turret, unable to move
- Built a building, on top of a building, making the topmost building almost inaccessable
- Not been able to open the map, ever

Within 90 minutes! This is not an oh it's an alpha you need to accept some bugs" case. This is a product exchanged for legal tender that is absolutely unplayable.

I feel violated. It's like they sent a throbbing train with houndreds of wrecked monster trucks loaded on it through my pie–outlet. One after another
date: never stopping until my intenstines and contents flew out of my oval office with the force of an anal tornado. Like a starved hyena for some orignality in the gaming world

reviewText:
Early Access Review

More like Asteroids on Steroids.

Do not buy this game, for that price at this moment, you don't get a game, more like a concept of the final game. The game sure has a lot of potential, but you should wait for a more playable build before stepping in. All in all, it can become really fun someday.

PS: Although the game is in Early Access, is far early in development then most games in EA. I've not paid for the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The basics are in game but there is a lot of game breaking bugs, i.e. unable to connect to servers, unable to build main hub when finally connected to servers and finally the big turret becoming non interactive  until game client restart. I had to restart multiple times during my short play through.

From what i saw during my time ingame, if it works there’s a lot of promise, its very pretty and quite fun to shoot down/collect the resources but till it’s more polished i couldn’t recommend buying unless you have money to burn
